channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: NTSB chair says Norfolk Southern tried to interfere with derailment probe after botching decision to blow open 5 tank cars and burn the chemicals inside
item.description: The NTSB also confirmed that the February 2023 derailment was caused by a wheel bearing that video showed was on fire for more than 20 miles beforehand but wasn't caught in time by inaccurate trackside detectors.

item.title: U.S. chip curbs in Middle East just 'business as usual,' Ooredoo CEO says after Nvidia deal
item.description: Ooredoo earlier this week signed a partnership with Nvidia, marking the chipmaker's first large-scale entry into the Middle East market. The companies did not disclose the value of the deal.

item.title: Volkswagen shareholders give lukewarm reception to $5 billion Rivian deal
Novo Nordisk’s Wegovy may just have two years to take over China’s market for weight loss drugs
item.description: Novo Nordisk's China patent on Wegovy's active ingredient expires in 2026, much earlier than its patents in the U.S., Japan and Europe.

item.title: Trade feuds aside, Chinese firms are committed to the U.S. market, survey shows
item.description: A survey of Chinese enterprises in the U.S. has found that a majority remain bullish on the market long-term despite concerns about U.S.-China relations.

item.title: Here’s how much profit McDonald’s makes on its new $5 meal
Tornado warnings, flash flooding and large hail add insult to injury in the Midwest: ‘Nature doesn’t care whether you believe in climate change or not’
item.description: A vast swath of land from eastern Nebraska and South Dakota to Iowa and Minnesota has been under siege from flooding from torrential rains since last week, while also being hit with a scorching heat wave.

item.title: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange walks free after reaching U.S. plea deal, bound for Australia
item.description: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange on Wednesday walked free after pleading guilty in a U.S. court in the Northern Mariana Islands, a U.S. commonwealth in the Pacific.

item.title: Stock-market buyback blackout period could spark dip as earnings season begins
GM brings in Xbox engineer as CEO to steer beleaguered Cruise robotaxi service
item.description: Marc Whitten, one of the key engineers behind the Xbox video game console, will take over as Cruise's chief executive.

item.title: Shopee agreed to adjust its practices in Indonesia after watchdog says it violated competition law
item.description: Indonesia Competition Commission said Shopee proposed adjustments to its current practices and that the request has been approved.

item.title: Broadcom loses a Boeing’s worth of market cap during five-session slide
FDA warns Sara Lee and Entenmann’s maker to stop using labels that say their foods contain potentially dangerous allergens when they don’t
item.description: Bimbo Bakeries USA listed ingredients such as sesame or tree nuts on labels even when they weren't in the foods.

item.title: Europe is at risk of over-restricting AI and falling behind U.S. and China, Dutch prince says
item.description: Prince Constantijn of the Netherlands told CNBC Europe risks limiting its role in artificial intelligence to being a regulator, rather than an innovator.

item.title: Nvidia’s stock selloff inspired retail investors to buy the dip
